recommendations: Avinash is one of the most technically adept engineers I've come across. He excels at assessing a problem and developing a practical, implementable solution, where he can apply his critical thinking and analysis skills. And his programming ability is second to none. When our team began transitioning critical applications and data into a public cloud, he was instrumental in refactoring key parts of the architecture to ensure they were optimized for cloud operation. Here's my advice: give Avinash your hardest technology problems, and you will not be disappointed.

Avinash ranks among the top 2 or 3 software engineers I’ve worked with in my career. His passion drives him to understand the big picture and to dig deep into the details to solve the toughest problems. He thoroughly understands large-scale web architectures, but, more importantly, knows how to make them work. He knows how to get things done, inspiring and leading teams around him to do so as well. Avinash never hesitates to mentor other engineers, teaching his craft to those with less experience and has a great ability to identify other engineers with talent. Though I believe he is a software engineer at heart, he also has the ability to manage teams and explain difficult technical issues to business stakeholders. I would not hesitate to work with Avinash or have him on my team.

Avinash is one of the best engineers that I have worked with. Avinash has a  thorough and deep knowledge about Web services, SOA, design patterns in implementing large scale web oriented solutions. Avinash played a pivotal role in developing and deploying cloud based solutions at Apollo.Avinash exhibited a number of leadership attributes and was a great role model for the team. Avinash is very good at communication and is a great team player that always puts the team's interests first. Avinash mentored junior developers and provided coaching and training to the junior developers and helped them be successful. Avinash's role model behavior resulted in the creation of new job title named "Principal Engineer" and he was one of the first ones to be nominated as a Principal Engineer at Apollo.

summary: I have over 15 years of experience in the Software and related IT fields. I seek opportunities for  delivering products and setting a product strategy and direction that generates business results in terms of revenue generation or improve the business efficiency. My responsibilities have included roles of a Project manager,People manager Software Architect, Technical lead ,  Application Developer. Worked in various software methodologies like waterfall, XP, Scrum.    * IT Manager with broad experience in all aspects of project management , Software Application development, managing the product requirements with the Business teams, scheduling and planning the delivery of the requirements. Lead a team to build an event driven architecture for the delivery of and exchange of events with in an organization between multiple Applications in a reliable and efficient manner. Also Managed a team that implemented and supported a large number of services used  by about 20-30 applications as a means of services based integration with in the organization    * Application Developer  and Technical lead in a wide variety of business applications in the education domain. Lead projects that built a CRM based system in the education domain. Experienced in the lead generation and building systems that handle the leads for education domain. Experience building rich internet scalable applications with Oracle database back-ends.Specialties: Enterprise Integration SolutionsService Oriented Architecture:	•	webservices, - soap, rest, hessian, cxf, axis,Spring WS•	WS-Secuirty, SAML 2.0, Secure Token Service (WS-Trust)	•	Service Governance, service tracking	•	XML, XSLT,WSDL,XpathEnterprise Driven Architecture:	•	Event generation,Events	•	Messaging - JMS, Jboss MQ(Hornet MQ), Apache MQ,Oracle AQ,Camel
